column4: i can't get pidgin to work on my machine.  when i run it, nothing happens
is there something better i can use than pidgin?
you could try running it from a terminal and see if it tells you anything, and as for better.... no, not so much :S  aMSN gives you msn but is more flaky than pidgin
when i ran pidgin from the terminal, nothing happened, it just returned the prompt
i must have uninstalled something to make it not work :/
wow, i just ran it and got thousands of lines of debugging :S
